Post Description:
Some members of the public have asked, during the open segment of the MFA Town Hall, about the potential opening of our borders. I know many are eager to travel again, be it to neighbouring countries or further, for business or to visit relatives. Others have, on the other hand, urged caution about opening up borders too quickly. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
The reality is that we have to be prepared that overseas travel even to nearby destinations will not return to its pre-COVID-19 state in the near to medium term. But we must re-build our external links gradually, carefully, and pragmatically. Singapore has implemented the Singapore-China Fast Lane for Essential Travel, and we are in discussions with other countries to establish reciprocal green lane arrangements.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
In addition, we are working with Malaysia to address the needs of cross-border travellers. These arrangements will have to include mutually agreed public health protocols, to preserve the public health and safety of citizens on both sides. Discussions will take time, and we have to be thorough to ensure a stable recovery from the COVID-19 situation.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Transcript of my remarks here: https://go.gov.sg/mfa-townhall-22june
Comments: Be calm, be safe & be vigilant

Post Description:
We are in Phase One of the post-Circuit Breaker period and have to carefully and safely restore some normalcy to our lives, especially on the work front. One key question is how to re-enable safe travel for essential business and official purposes.‚†Ä ‚†Ä
A Singapore-China ‚Äòfast lane‚Äô was launched on 8 June 2020. Both sides have formulated detailed precautions to ensure that cross border transmission does not occur.‚†Ä ‚†Ä
Singapore is discussing similar arrangements with other partners. The gradual and safe reopening of our borders will help underpin Singapore‚Äôs position as a safe and reliable business, financial and aviation hub for the region.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
More details in the press statement here: https://go.gov.sg/9i5zy5
Comments: When are we opening flights to Chennai, India? We need to travel back to SG

Post Description:
Just launched our second Scoot flight to Wuhan. It is extra special because today marks ‚ÄòChap Goh Mei‚Äô, a day for family reunion in Chinese tradition. This flight will bring our Singaporeans and their family members back home from Wuhan. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
We also gave some diagnostic test kits and medical supplies for the novel coronavirus to China this afternoon through PRC Ambassador Hong Xiaoyong. We must credit the Chinese for sequencing and releasing the full genome of the virus by mid-January, which enabled multiple research centers across the world, including A*STAR in Singapore, to rapidly develop test kits for specific identification of the 2019-nCov.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Infectious diseases do not stop at the border. We can only overcome this global challenge by working together, at both the national and international level. Singapore will continue to work closely with China and the international community to tackle the challenge.‚†Ä ‚†Ä
#SGUnited  #SingaporeTogether
Comments: Can u set up special unit to tackle the queue at ntuc first sirthat one needs ur urgent attention then launching another Wuhan flight..... localization first .... central control rapidly swamped in face of complexity, stifling weak organic adaptation
